thread.title: Tim Kaine’s Youngest Son Arrested In Minnesota After Riot at Trump Rally
thread.title_full: Tim Kaine’s Youngest Son Arrested In Minnesota After Riot at Trump Rally

author: Nick Bolger
title: Tim Kaine’s Youngest Son Arrested In Minnesota After Riot at Trump Rally
text:
The youngest son of Sen. Tim Kaine (D., Va.) was arrested Saturday in St. Paul, Minnesota after protesters disrupted a pro-Donald Trump rally at the State Capitol.
Linwood Michael Kaine, 24, was arrested on suspicion of second-degree riot during the "March 4 Trump" rally, according to the Pioneer Press .
Four others were arrested along with Kaine for the same reason, while one person was cited for disorderly conduct. The arrests came after anti-Trump protesters disrupted a demonstration in support of the president with air horns, whistles, chants, and at least smoke bomb.
Kaine, whose father was Hillary Clinton's running mate during the 2016 presidential election, was released from Ramsey County jail on Tuesday and no charges were filed against him or the four others reportedly involved int the protest.
Sen. Kaine released a statement to the Pioneer Press expressing support for his children.
"We love that our three children have their own views and concerns about current political issues," the former vice presidential candidate said. "They fully understand the responsibility to express those concerns peacefully."
St. Paul Police spokesman Steve Linders said after Linwood Kaine, who goes by "Woody," was detained, he "turned around and squared up to fight with the officer."
"The officer was able to place Mr. Kaine under arrest and take him to the Ramsey County jail for booking," Linders said.
Linwood Kaine did not respond to a voicemail left for him by the Pioneer Press .
The post Tim Kaine’s Youngest Son Arrested In Minnesota After Riot at Trump Rally appeared first on Washington Free Beacon .
